plan: I'd definitely regret bidding high if others bid low since I could've won with lower investment. On the flip side, I'd feel a missed opportunity if others bid higher. However, this is a risk-to-reward scenario; you can't always predict the other bidders' actions perfectly. For this round, I'll submit a middle-of-the-road bid, say $50, to obtain data for future bidding strategies.

I wouldn't regret my bid in either case. If others bid way lower, I win the prize, thus maximizing the round profits. If others bid way higher, they may overpay. Over time, if they continue, this might exhaust their resources, enabling me to win later at lower costs, advancing the long-term profit.

My bid: $50.
